thread.title: Piers Morgan mocks Tony Blair for supporting Newcastle United on GMB

author: Sean Seddon
title: Piers Morgan mocks Tony Blair for supporting Newcastle United on GMB
text:
News Piers Morgan mocks Tony Blair for supporting Newcastle United on GMB The former Labour Prime Minister went on ITV's Good Morning Britain to discuss a range of topics - but the Arsenal-supporting host seized on his fondness for Newcastle to mock him Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily
Piers Morgan gave former Prime Minister Tony Blair some stick on Good Morning Britain - over his support for Newcastle United.
Mr Blair , who represented the County Durham constituency of Sedgefield in Parliament, went on the ITV show on Monday to discuss a range of topics.
But at the end of the interview host Piers Morgan turned the conversation onto football by referencing Arsenal's 4-2 win over North London rivals Tottenham Hotspur.
The vocal Gunners fan described the derby win as a "momentous day" before asking Mr Blair who he supported. Alan Shearer with Tony Blair after his testimonial cheque presentation
Mr Blair confirmed he supports Newcastle United , prompting some needle from Morgan, who said "we don't want to talk about that, it will only depress you".
The former PM retorted that "we are still in the premier division" but couldn't getting a word in edgeways against the gloating host.
Piers Morgan says David Beckham is 'weird' for kissing his daughter on the lips
Mr Blair, who was born in Scotland but lived in Durham as a child, has long been a supporter of the club.
He attended a game at St James' Park shortly after becoming Prime Minister and says he used to attend as a child. Tony Blair keeps goal during a visit to a football training session at Devonshire Primary School Blackpool. Blair was accompanied by then-Manchester United manager Alex Ferguson during the visit (Image: Daily Mirror)
The ex-Labour leader once said his favourite 50th birthday gift was a number 9 shirt signed by Alan Shearer.
Mr Blair also discussed a second referendum on EU membership, saying it was the only way to settle the deadlock in Parliament.
Mr Blair, who is in favour of a second vote, said the choice should be between a hard Brexit or staying in the European Union. Read More
